intro: Galium linifolium var. rigidulum, commonly known as rigid-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are typically linear and have a slightly rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
